N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 177.10 - Ombudsman reports

State Regulations

As soon as possible after visiting a facility or program and
receiving the complaints or grievances of youth, the ombudsman shall discuss
with the facility or program director or his/her designee the grievances or
complaints brought to his/her attention. The ombudsman shall submit regular
reports, at least monthly, which shall contain information regarding major
grievances, complaints received and other matters needing attention. The
reports shall contain items such as a recitation of the issue or complaint, a
brief statement of facts, and the conclusions and recommendations of the
ombudsman. The reports shall be forwarded unaltered by the director of the
office of the ombudsman to the director of the division and other appropriate
agency officials and to the division's Independent Review Board. When the
facility or program director has conducted an investigation into the matters
reported by the ombudsman, the findings of such director shall be included in
the ombudsman's report. Notes
